tool.name: tool_15

param.name: INPUT
param.dialogReference:
Grid

Grid, input

Grid to reclassify.

param.name: RESULT
param.dialogReference:
Reclassified Grid

Grid, output

Reclassified grid.

param.name: METHOD
param.dialogReference:
Method

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] single

[1] range

[2] simple table

[3] user supplied table

Default: 0

Select the desired method: (1) a single value or a range defined by a single value is reclassified, (2) a range of values is reclassified, (3) and (4) a lookup table is used to reclassify the grid.

param.name: OLD
param.dialogReference:
Old Value

Floating point

Default: 0.000000

Value to reclassify.

param.name: NEW
param.dialogReference:
New Value

Floating point

Default: 1.000000

The value to assign (with method 'single value').

param.name: SOPERATOR
param.dialogReference:
Operator

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] =

[1] <

[2] <=

[3] >=

[4] >

Default: 0

Select the desired operator; it is possible to define a range above or below the old value.

param.name: MIN
param.dialogReference:
Minimum Value

Floating point

Default: 0.000000

The minimum value of the range to be reclassified.

param.name: MAX
param.dialogReference:
Maximum Value

Floating point

Default: 10.000000

The maximum value of the range to be reclassified.

param.name: RNEW
param.dialogReference:
New Value

Floating point

Default: 5.000000

The value to assign (with method 'range').

param.name: ROPERATOR
param.dialogReference:
Operator

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] <=

[1] <

Default: 0

Select the desired operator (for method 'range'): eg. min < value < max.

param.name: RETAB
param.dialogReference:
Lookup Table

Static table

3 Fields:

- 1. [8 byte floating point number] minimum

- 2. [8 byte floating point number] maximum

- 3. [8 byte floating point number] new

The lookup table used with method 'table'.

param.name: TOPERATOR
param.dialogReference:
Operator

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] min <= value < max

[1] min <= value <= max

[2] min < value <= max

[3] min < value < max

Default: 0

Select the desired operator (for method 'table').

param.name: RETAB_2
param.dialogReference:
Lookup Table

Table, input, optional

optional

The lookup table used with method 'user supplied table'.

param.name: F_MIN
param.dialogReference:
Minimum Value

Table field

The table field with the minimum value.

param.name: F_MAX
param.dialogReference:
Maximum Value

Table field

The table field with the maximum value.

param.name: F_CODE
param.dialogReference:
New Value

Table field

The table field with the value to assign.

param.name: NODATAOPT
param.dialogReference:
No Data Values

Boolean

Default: 0

Use this option to reclassify No Data values independently of the method settings.

param.name: NODATA
param.dialogReference:
New Value

Floating point

Default: 0.000000

The value to assign to No Data values.

param.name: OTHEROPT
param.dialogReference:
Other Values

Boolean

Default: 0

Use this option to reclassify all values that are not included in the reclassification setup.

param.name: OTHERS
param.dialogReference:
New Value

Floating point

Default: 0.000000

The value to assign to all values not included in the reclassification setup.

param.name: RESULT_TYPE
param.dialogReference:
Data Storage Type

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] 1 bit

[1] 1 byte unsigned integer

[2] 1 byte signed integer

[3] 2 byte unsigned integer

[4] 2 byte signed integer

[5] 4 byte unsigned integer

[6] 4 byte signed integer

[7] 4 byte floating point

[8] 8 byte floating point

[9] same as input grid

Default: 9

The data storage type of the output grid.

param.name: RESULT_NODATA_CHOICE
param.dialogReference:
No Data Value

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] No Data value of input grid

[1] user defined No Data value

[2] No Data value of data storage type

Default: 0

Choose how to handle the No Data value of the output grid.

param.name: RESULT_NODATA_VALUE
param.dialogReference:
No Data Value

Floating point

Default: -99999.000000

User defined No Data value for output grid.

tool.summary:
The tool can be used to reclassify the values of a grid. It provides three different options: (a) reclassification of single values (b) reclassification of a range of values (c) reclassification of value ranges specified in a lookup table (simple or user supplied table)
In addition to these methods, two special cases (No Data values and values not included in the reclassification setup) are supported. With reclassification mode (a) and (b), the 'No Data' option is evaluated before the 'Method' settings. In reclassification mode (c) the option is evaluated only if the No Data value is not included in the lookup table. The 'Other Values' option is always evaluated after checking the 'Method' settings.
The tool also provides options to control the data storage type and No Data value of the output grid.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Conrad, O., Bechtel, B., Bock, M., Dietrich, H., Fischer, E., Gerlitz, L., Wehberg, J., Wichmann, V., and Boehner, J. (2015): System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses (SAGA) v. 2.1.4, Geosci. Model Dev., 8, 1991-2007, doi:10.5194/gmd-8-1991-2015. [SAGA - System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses - saga-gis.org]
